intro: Astragalus playanus, commonly known as the Playa milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in playas, which are ephemeral wetlands. Astragalus playanus plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
